title_slide.title: Smart Waste Segregation using AI
title_slide.subtitle: Automated Waste Classification using Deep Learning
title_slide.author: Shell-Edunet x AICTE Green Skills Internship

problem_statement.title: Problem Statement
points: Improper waste segregation is a major environmental challenge in modern cities
70% of recyclable materials end up in landfills due to inefficient manual sorting
Lack of awareness leads to contamination in recycling streams
Manual waste sorting is time-consuming, expensive, and error-prone
Need for automated, accurate, and scalable waste classification solution
problem_statement.impact: Global waste generation expected to reach 3.4 billion tonnes by 2050

solution.title: Our Solution
solution.main_solution: AI-Powered Waste Classification System using Deep Learning
features: Automated image-based waste classification into 3 categories
Real-time predictions with 93% accuracy using VGG16 Transfer Learning
User-friendly Streamlit web interface for easy access
Instant disposal recommendations for each waste item
Scalable solution deployable in smart cities and waste management facilities
solution.technology: Leverages Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) and Transfer Learning

learning_objectives.title: Learning Objectives
objectives: Understand and implement deep learning for image classification
Apply Transfer Learning techniques using pre-trained models (VGG16)
Develop end-to-end ML pipeline: data preprocessing, training, evaluation
Create production-ready web applications using Streamlit
Analyze model performance using confusion matrix and metrics
Address real-world sustainability challenges using AI
Implement best practices in ML project development and deployment

steps: Collected 30,000+ waste images from Kaggle dataset
Organized into 3 categories: Recyclable, Organic, Non-Recyclable
Applied data augmentation: rotation, flip, zoom, shift
Week 1: Built baseline CNN model (82% accuracy)
Froze base layers, added custom classification head
Applied fine-tuning on top layers for optimization
Trained model for 20 epochs with early stopping
Used Adam optimizer with learning rate scheduling
Generated confusion matrix and performance metrics
Integrated trained model for real-time predictions
Created intuitive UI with image upload functionality
Added disposal guidance and sustainability information

sustainability_impact.title: Sustainability Impact
sustainability_impact.sdg_alignment: UN SDG 12: Responsible Consumption and Production
environmental_benefits: Reduced landfill waste through better sorting
social_impact: Cost reduction in waste management operations
Job creation in waste processing sector

challenges_and_learnings.title: Challenges & Learnings
challenges: Limited dataset size for some waste categories
Varying image quality and lighting conditions
solutions: Used Transfer Learning to leverage pre-trained features
Balanced model complexity with deployment requirements
key_learnings: Data quality is as important as quantity
User interface design is crucial for adoption

future_scope.title: Future Scope & Enhancements
short_term: Expand to more waste categories (e-waste, hazardous, etc.)
Mobile app development for on-the-go classification
long_term: IoT integration for automated sorting systems
Blockchain for waste tracking and rewards

conclusion.title: Conclusion
summary: Successfully developed an AI-powered waste classification system with 93% accuracy
Implemented end-to-end ML pipeline from data collection to deployment
Created user-friendly web application for real-time waste classification
Demonstrated practical application of Transfer Learning and Deep Learning
Contributed to environmental sustainability through technology
conclusion.impact_statement: This project showcases how AI can be leveraged to address critical environmental challenges and support sustainable development goals.
